trans-unit.source: Create the console application and obtain the assembly
trans-unit.target: Create the console application and obtain the assembly

trans-unit.source: To create a new console application in Visual Studio and install the NuGet package containing the Azure Storage Client Library:
trans-unit.target: To create a new console application in Visual Studio and install the NuGet package containing the Azure Storage Client Library:

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, choose **File > New Project**, and then choose **Windows > Console Application** from the list of Visual C# templates.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, choose **File > New Project**, and then choose **Windows > Console Application** from the list of Visual C# templates.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for the console application, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for the console application, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Once your project has been created, right-click the project in Solution Explorer and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: Once your project has been created, right-click the project in Solution Explorer and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Search online for "WindowsAzure.Storage" and click **Install** to install the Azure Storage Client Library for .NET package and dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Search online for "WindowsAzure.Storage" and click **Install** to install the Azure Storage Client Library for .NET package and dependencies.

trans-unit.source: The code examples in this article also use the [Microsoft Azure Configuration Manager Library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt634646.aspx) to retrieve the storage connection string from an app.config file in the console application.
trans-unit.target: The code examples in this article also use the [Microsoft Azure Configuration Manager Library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt634646.aspx) to retrieve the storage connection string from an app.config file in the console application.

trans-unit.source: With Azure Configuration Manager, you can retrieve your connection string at runtime regardless of whether your application is running in Microsoft Azure or from a desktop, mobile, or web application.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Configuration Manager, you can retrieve your connection string at runtime regardless of whether your application is running in Microsoft Azure or from a desktop, mobile, or web application.

trans-unit.source: To install the Azure Configuration Manager package, right-click the project in Solution Explorer and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: To install the Azure Configuration Manager package, right-click the project in Solution Explorer and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Search online for "ConfigurationManager" and click **Install** to install the package.
trans-unit.target: Search online for "ConfigurationManager" and click **Install** to install the package.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure Configuration Manager is optional.
trans-unit.target: Using Azure Configuration Manager is optional.

trans-unit.source: You can also use an API such as the .NET Framework's [ConfigurationManager class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.configuration.configurationmanager.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can also use an API such as the .NET Framework's [ConfigurationManager class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.configuration.configurationmanager.aspx).
